instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMCâ€™s voltage sensors & other sensors..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message:
Without screen, SSD, flex cable: Permanent green light, full fan speed, no sings of booting, no usb activity
Without screen, SSD but with flex cable: Green/Orange light, full fan speed, apple chime, no usb activity
With screen, no SSD but with flex cable, Green/Orange light, full fan speed, apple chime repeating one after the other as if the board keeps resetting, no usb activity

Board in general very clear with no sings of corrosion, <CHIP>U5600</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R5600</RESISTOR> seems to be replaced, so not sure if that area indicates to anything. However all voltage / diode readings at this are are good.

Edit: Boots up further with an SMC bypass, arrives to flashing question mark.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message:
What flex cable did you reffer?

Fan spins to max if no trackpad board/flex connected.
Same if thermal issue is detected.

Booting in SMC bypass, should be caused by an I/V sensor; check the outputs from pages 41-43.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message:
Sorry, I meant the flex cable between DC IN board and the LB

Also I am a bit confused, for example <CHIP>U5490</CHIP>, according to the schematics is a INA211 current sensing amp. But on the board that location is blank (there are pads, but no chip), no signs of it being removed and same on other boards. What am I missing ? Or what should a measure if the chip or resistor is missing ?

What am I looking for page 41-43 ISENSE outputs ? Most of these are showing low voltages around 50-60mV.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message:
Several Isense chips are not installed.
In such case, corresponding R sense is shorted; nothing to check there.

You must check sensor outputs (if installed), when the machine is turned on in SMC bypass mode.
Start checking <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> = 2.7V
<SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> = 1.3V
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL> = 250mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> = 65mV

Also not sure if this helps, but while it is in restart loop (without SMC bypass) <SIGNAL>SMC_CPUVR_ADJUST_ISENSE_R</SIGNAL> was cycling between 0.5V and 3.0V. Perhaps a side effect of restarts but wanted to mention.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>SMC_CPUVR_ADJUST_ISENSE_R</SIGNAL> was cycling between 0.5V and 3.0V"
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_CPU_ISENSE</SIGNAL> at same time.

You should check all sensors output with machine in SMC bypass.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message:
Done, all outputs from pages 41-43 are below, taken during a successful boot using SMC-bypass.

I was sure I was seeing 1V on <SIGNAL>SMC_CPUVR_ADJUST_ISENSE</SIGNAL> on the first test (after multiple measurements), however after a reboot it start reporting 350mV which matches a good board.

<SIGNAL>SMC_HS_COMPUTING_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 77-80mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_OTHER_HI_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 21-22mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_P3V3S0_ISENSE</SIGNAL>  : 32 mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_CAMERA_ISENSE</SIGNAL>  : 23-24 mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 66-67 mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_1V2S3_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 284 mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_WLAN_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 28-29 mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_SSD_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 1.6-1.7 mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_LCDBKLT_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 31 mV

<SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> : 1.378 V
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> : 3.426 V
<SIGNAL>SMC_CPU_VSENSE</SIGNAL> : 1.8 V
<SIGNAL>SMC_P1V05S0_VSENSE</SIGNAL> : 1.06 V
<SIGNAL>SMC_P1V05S0_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 28 mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_CPU_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 282 mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_CPUDDR_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 33 mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_P3V3S5_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 28 mV

<SIGNAL>SMC_CPUVR_ADJUST_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 350 mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_PANEL_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 32 mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_HS_COMP_ALERT_L</SIGNAL> : 3.324 V
<SIGNAL>SMC_CPU_IMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 99-100 mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_COMP_ALERT_L</SIGNAL> : 3.32 V
<SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_DISCRETE_ISENSE</SIGNAL> : 2.2 mV

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message:
Test the machine again with original 45W charger (14.5V).
Or lower the lab PSU (if use one) to mentioned voltage; 20V is not proper voltage for an Air.
In fact, <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> reports 20.5V to SMC...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message:
It is a 45W branded charger which works fine with other a1466s. Tested using lab PSU at 14.5V as well, same behaviour.
Does <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> : 3.426 V mean DCIN is actually 20.5V ? How do we calculate 20.5 from 3.426 ? Just trying to understand.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message:
Then you have a problem with <RESISTOR>R5513</RESISTOR>/14 divider; inspect traces for corrosion.
Test with 33-36K in place of <RESISTOR>R5513</RESISTOR>, instead of actual 27K.
Check how changes <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message: Will do, what value am I expecting to see on <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message:
Vout=Vin*Rb/(Ra+Rb) is the classic formula for voltage divider.
Considering Ra=<RESISTOR>R5513</RESISTOR> and Rb=<RESISTOR>R5514</RESISTOR>, do I need to mention what is Vin and Vout?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> = 2.76 V, sorry if I mismeasured this one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message:
That is totally different thing; it means 16.5V DCIN.

So there must be another problem which prevent SMC to start the board in normal mode.
Check if <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> voltage is good (<CAPACITOR>C5125</CAPACITOR>).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message:
Maybe bad SMC, or broken solder/traces.
Reball it first...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message:
Thank you, I will try this. Perhaps rather reflowing, rather than reballing as I don't have balls to do it. Pun intended :)

Quick one, is it possible to run diagnostics via D while still doing SMC bypass? Tried but it seems to be shutting down abruptly if I keep D down. Perhaps SMC is involved with diagnostics ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message:
You can reball SMC with solder paste, not balls; many videos available on Internet.

For diagnostic, SMC needs to read all I/V and temp sensors.
Starting in SMC bypass disables sensors reading.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A boot issues
threads.message:
Yep, thank you. As you may imagine reflow did not help. I will try reballing next, got paste but no stencil. Trying to find one.

Thanks for all the help so far.
